newsitem.title: GERMANY: Meister sees risk of volatility if EMU doubts last.
newsitem.headline: Meister sees risk of volatility if EMU doubts last.

text.p: Bundesbank directorate member Edgar Meister said Tuesday there was a risk of market volatility increasing ahead of European monetary union if doubts about whether the single currency would be stable persisted into 1998.

The European Union will decide in early 1998 which nations qualify for the single currency, scheduled to be launched on January 1, 1999. The assessment of which nations meet the convergence criteria will be based on data for 1997.

"There is a danger that the volatility of financial markets will increase significantly in the run-up to European monetary union if the question of whether EMU will start as a community of stability remains open until the spring of 1998," Meister said according the text of a speech.
The speech on modern financial instruments, was due to be delivered at a conference in Darmstadt near Frankfurt.
